name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Well made. The quality you would expect from such a good company like Canterbury.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: These are great training shorts. The material is elastic and stretchy on your legs so they move with you as your running and moving. Inside the waist, there is an additional non-slip material that ensure they fit comfortably and don't move around. Great for the gym for work outs or if your out and above running

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Excellent quality as you would expect from Canterbury however the size guide mislead me. I purchased XS as I’m normally 28 waist however these are too small with the elastic being so tight, would fit a 24-26 waist.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Not the quality that I expect from CCC. They didn't even make it through one game of rugby! They ripped all the way down the back when I was squatting down.  I've had $10 Kipster shorts that lasted longer.

reviews: They are rather short ..mid thigh and they have a rather course plastic texture and large parts of elastic.. but still very nice for the price

name: Canterbury Advantage Short

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Edit 29th Apr 18. Worn about 20 times since purchase and now ripped at stitching at rear seam whilst squatting. This is not at the stretch panel, shame they didnt use a bit of the stretch panel at the rear seam.Over all still good shorts but just cant handle heavy squatting. I am tempted to try a larger size see if the extra room will perform better.Very strong shorts with stretch material in backside area which is good for squatting, as they don’t rip like most do under heavy load. They have a good rise as well which is rare in today’s climate of shorts hanging half way down your backside. However they are totally let down when it comes to leg room. I purchased a size up from what I needed as recommended in another review and they are barley loose on my thighs. After squatting in them I have been left with red marks and bruising where the material has been so tight around my thighs. I thought rugby shorts would be good due to the leg size of the players, clearly not in this case. If you have larger thighs (mine are only 29 inches, so I don’t consider them large at all) and plan on doing gym work I would avoid these. Such a shame as could have been perfect with 1-2 more inch of thigh room.

reviews: Product is sweet. Fits well (230lb 6ft4 with xl) maybe the description stated no pockets but I didn't see it. Good waste band. Took a while to ship but fair price.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: Produkt kam sowas von SOFORT, damit habe ich nicht gerechnet! Die shorts sind rugby-typisch relativ eng und robust - sollte auch am feld eine gute figur machen. Ohne die dehnbaren Stellen am Oberschenkel aussen und im Schritt wäre ein „normales“ Bewegen wohl nicht möglich - für rugby aber wunderbar. Die Shorts sind relativ kurz (wie beschrieben und wie gewollt), relativ eng und mit Größe Large (bei 183 cm Körpergröße und normalerweise Hosengröße je nach Schnitt 34 oder 36) noch gut passend, aber viel Platz ist dann nicht mehr. Qualität wie erwartet sehr gut!
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 7 June 2021

reviews: Great additional elastication made them a great fit for my 9 year old daughter. She’s solid! They don’t trap round her thighs and allow good flex when bending. Much better than the ones without the gusset.

reviews: Très belle matière, ont sens la qualitée et le rendu final.Il s'agit d'un short qui rend une très belle impression après 3 jours d'utilisation.Peut être juste une remarque négative sur la taille, prendez gardes, car l'élastique est très sérrer, prévoyez peut être une taille au dessus.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 1 January 2020

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: These are extremely durable, comfortable shorts. I wear these primarily for no-gi Brazilian jiu-jitsu (BJJ) and am very pleased with their performance overall. BJJ-oriented brands commonly offer lower quality shorts at nearly double the price.There are just a couple of things I would love to see improved:- The black shorts appear to be very dark blue. If you wear them with anything else that's actually black, the contrast can be pretty obvious.- The "legs" could be slightly stretchier to enable greater mobility. There is an elastic panel in the crotch area, and the leg openings are generously sized, but additional elastic panels on the fronts/sides of the legs would be nice.
date.of.review: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on 3 March 2019

They’re also short, which to some like myself is more comfortable. They don’t have any annoying Velcro, and the grips on the inside of the waistband are a welcome feature. Can’t imagine wearing anything else at this point.

name: Canterbury Advantage Short
reviews: I love these shorts. Although a rugby player, I actually bought them for the gym. Having quite big thighs and butt, I struggle with most training pants, particularly at the bottom of the squat. I have ripped several trousers this way and the result with some shorts is that they stick on the thighs and pull the waistband down, so I end up partially mooning the rest of the gym while in the squat rack!The added thick lycra/ stretch areas around the groin and sides of the thighs mean these babies stay right where you put the on and no risk of exploding out of them. Tough and durable as well and the material doesn't fade when washed. So the colour looks crisp still after several washes.
